title: How Many Calories in a Caesar Salad?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in caesar salad per serving, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and tips for lighter versions.
h1: How Many Calories in a Caesar Salad?
assumptions: Standard restaurant serving (~250 g) with romaine lettuce, caesar dressing, croutons, and parmesan cheese; no chicken or add-ins.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, dressing amount, and ingredients; homemade or restaurant versions differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical Caesar salad serving has about 350 kcal, mostly from the creamy dressing.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Use light caesar dressing (reduce fat by half)

faqs.q: How many calories is in caesar salad without dressing?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal, mainly from lettuce, croutons, and cheese.

faqs.q: Is caesar salad high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 800 mg per serving due to dressing and parmesan.

faqs.q: How much protein in a caesar salad?
faqs.a: Around 8 g per serving; add chicken for 25+ g.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in caesar salad?
faqs.a: About 28 g total fat, with 5 g saturated, mostly from the dressing.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-calorie caesar salad?
faqs.a: Yes, use light dressing, skip croutons, and add veggies to drop it to under 250 kcal.
